definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: Even if the stomach, also don't want to take medicine. " x0 h!"
sentences.chinese: 就算胃疼的要死，也不会想要吃药。

sentences.english: ChiTian looking incentive eight heavy, if you really want to die, and death on the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 池田借机激励八重，如果真的想死，也要死在战场上。

sentences.english: What interests me are those who living and dying for me.
sentences.chinese: 令我感到兴趣的是那些为我要死要活的人。

sentences.english: The scene horripilated her to death.
You are not here. I am worried to death.
sentences.chinese: 你去哪里了，真把我急得要死。

sentences.english: Front she were placed in pot inside and half alive half dead, and now it becomes like a lady.
sentences.chinese: 前面被烫的要死要活的，现在倒是像一个偏偏淑女了。

sentences.english: You might be dead tomorrow, so you might as well enjoy this meat while you have it.
sentences.chinese: 明天我们可能都要死了，现在有肉吃，就只管吃吧。

sentences.english: And she sank down as though on the point of death.
sentences.chinese: 她好象要死似的，瘫软下去了。

sentences.english: If the dead are not raised, let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.
sentences.chinese: 若死人不复活，我们就吃吃喝喝吧，因为明天要死了。

sentences.english: The young apprentis is pretty afraid of his boss.
sentences.chinese: 小学徒对老板怕得要死。

sentences.english: That was the first time she home during the weekends, bored to death. (leave)
sentences.chinese: 这是她第一次周末被独自留在家，她烦得要死。

sentences.english: People live, kill and die for love.
sentences.chinese: 人们会为爱情要死要活。

sentences.english: An elderly lawyer was about to die.
sentences.chinese: 一个老律师就要死了罼。

sentences.english: It was about an hour later that the geese woke up. They had devastating hangovers.
sentences.chinese: 约莫一个钟头以后这些鹅醒了，宿醉得要死不活。

sentences.english: To beat liu zhu black yellow, even to death his revenge for south feather.
sentences.chinese: 刘地打败朱黑黄，还要要死他为南羽报仇。

sentences.english: But what about loving your pet to death?
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果你对自己的宠特爱得要死，怎么办？

definition: half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life
to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
